Title: the scavenger vortex

Scene: Penny’s apartment. (Montage with scenes in the apartment and Leonard’s bedroom)
The geology lab at the University.
The apartment stairwell. Leonard is lowering himself down the lift shaft.
Raj: So, couldn’t help but notice none of you RSVP’d to my murder mystery dinner party.
No, you weren’t because it was a week ago and nobody came. So, if you want to solve the mystery of who stabbed Koothrappali in the back with the weapon of indifference, it was all of you.
Don’t worry, I can take a hint. No more murder mystery parties.
Because I’ve got something even better planned.
Just hear me out. I’m going to make you guys a scavenger hunt like they have at M.I.T.
So, uh, who’s in?
Okay, everybody. Who’s ready for a scavenger hunt?
Any questions?
Okay, guys, go ahead and divide yourselves into teams of two.
Oh, hey, thanks for letting me use the comic book store as part of the scavenger hunt.
Oh, congratulations. You’re the first team to arrive.
Your next puzzle is a riddle. And who better to give it to you than The Riddler?
Good riddle, huh?
I invited you to my murder mystery party.
Oh.
Oh, yes, Leonard. Yes, it was.
Yes, exactly. Where is the coin? Why don’t you look in your pockets? I slipped them in there earlier today.
Don’t you see? When we’re all having fun together, we’re already winners. Oh, look. See? Even I’m a winner.
Well, I thought… Come on, I didn’t want anyone to feel bad at the end of the game. And some of those puzzles were really hard and I didn’t know who was gonna get Penny.
Okay, okay, that-that came out wrong, but you have to admit, you all had a wonderful time.
I just wanted to do something beautiful.
Leonard: Oh, yeah. We were meaning to do that.
Great.
Aw.
We did them at Princeton, too.
Oh, these are a little different. There’s a tradition at elite universities…
A tradition of hunts full of puzzles that rely on logic and obscure knowledge, science.
I think it sounds fun.
What’s all this?
You really think he’s gonna send us to a bowling alley?
It’s not funny.
Ha-ha.
Couples sounds great. Or we could mix things up. Maybe pick names out of a hat. Whatever.
I just said, couples sound great.
All right, let’s, let’s do couples. I want to.
Stop yelling at me.
Do you think Penny’s mad at me?
No, because I didn’t want her on my team.
Geez, I never realized you were so competitive.
I have asthma. Back off.
Hey, Penny, I just wanted to say good luck, and I hope there’s no hard feelings.
Relax, it’s a hard puzzle. It’s gonna take a while to solve.
Wait, I got it. I got it/
You’re really mean, you know that?
Um, I’m okay with you driving my car. I’m not okay with you flying my car.
Uh-huh. Like death?
Penny’s not answering my texts.
This stupid game is why she’s mad in the first place. I’m telling her I’m quitting.
Why?
What does she think I am?
I can’t believe she would say that about me.
Call me a lady part. We’ll see about that.
Almost.
Got it.
Yeah, Penny might be onto something.
To the tar pits.
The clue must be in the bag.
It’s just a bunch of pants.
Well, why would you want to be on someone’s team who you like to call a, I can’t even say it in front of Sheldon.
You know exactly what I’m talking about.
Why would you do that?
Hey, I am every bit as much of a man as Penny. Now, let’s do this.
This one is, too.
Wasn’t the answer Sheldon’s spot?
Are you kidding me?
Sheldon: I don’t think thatqualifies as a mystery, we all knew what we were doing.
Thank you.
Come on.
That’s amusing, I was going to say that about M.I.T., but it works for Princeton, too.
I’m sorry. Are we really doing this or are we tricking Koothrappali again like with the dinner party?
Oh, everything I could possibly need to win the scavenger hunt.
Well, if he does, do you know how filthy those rental balls are? They might as well stand on the corner and give away free rectal exams.
He is a born showman.
No, Oh, it actually is if you get the joke. It’s based on the premise that Princeton isn’t a very good school.
Oh, see? Now he gets it.
Really? The only time I’m ever picked first for a team and I’m stuck with the liability?
Yes, and do you know what the odds are I’d pick your name?
It’s not hard, one in five. Now you know why I’m pouting.
What are you doing? You have to start with the edges.
Yeah, well, take them apart and start with the edges. And stop wasting time.
But we haven’t finished the puzzle.
You think you know the answer. But it could be a trick. What if when the puzzle’s complete, there’s a sign in the window that says go to the train store?
Well, I hope you’re wrong. I really want to go to the train store.
It’s the comic book store.
It is a marathon, not a sprint.
Not with a bowling ball on their back.
Got it.
I thought we were the Lightning Sharks.
The next clue must be hidden under one of these rocks.

Oh, simple, the ‘arrah, ‘arrah in the riddle mean Jan Arrah, a member of the Legion of Superheroes, known as Element Lad. And then the word He, it wasn’t the masculine pronoun, but rather H e, the abbreviation for helium. See where I’m going with this?

Nice try. Now, Element Lad’s ability is the power to transmute chemical elements. Helium has an atomic number of two. If you multiply that by the atomic number of N, nitrogen, you get 14, which is the atomic number of? I’m just funnin’ you, silicon. And that is the most common element in the Earth’s surface. So that narrowed it down to the geology lab or the chemistry lab.
And I’m sure your parents are proud. Now, finally, the line in this room the thing you’ll see was an obvious reference to Fantastic Four member The Thing, who’s made entirely of…
Those are map coordinates. Got ’em. Let’s go.
No one likes a know-it-all, Penny.
Okay, another 30 feet.
Yes. Yes. My brain is better than everybody’s.
To the planetarium.
It’s dirty laundry. You’re up.
Because you’ve been training for this your whole life. You live in a pile of dirty laundry.
I’m not a child. I know the word ninny.
Wait, it’s not all pants, there’s one shirt.
Hey, that’s my shirt.
No, no, that’s not mine. It has a big spot on it.
Oh, that’s clever.
Be there in a minute. I just have to pre-soak these.
Amy: We’re sorry, Rajesh.
Scavenger hunts at Harvard were really tough. I always got stuck on the first challenge, trying to find someone to be on a team with me. I guess that story’s more sad than funny.
Yeah, me, too.
Stop that. Penny is not a liability.
Maybe we pick names out of a hat.
I did them all the time as a kid. As my mom used to say, when you’re doing a puzzle, it’s like having a thousand friends. She was full of fun lies like that.
I’m sorry you got stuck with me. I bet you wanted to be with Bernadette.
No.
I think this is the first time we’ve ever actually been alone together.
Well, off the top of my head, I’d say we don’t have a lot in common except for the people we’re involved with. Plus, when we first met, Penny warned me never to get into a car alone with you.
Such as?
Uh, let’s see. I like harps, Little House on the Prairie, medieval poetry, medieval literature…
Great. Sheldon never lets me listen to music in the car. He doesn’t want to be mistaken for a gang member.
Beatles, boring. Eminem, scary. Weird Al? How old are you? Neil Diamond?
I love Neil Diamond.
Yes, it’s not a ruse to make fun of me. It’s a real game and I’m winning it.
Oh, oh, that’s good. Then this would be
To the Neil Mobile.
They’re coming to America.
They’re coming to America… ♪
Today!
Ain’t no big surprise.
And I’ll tell you some lies.
There’s a Neil Diamond concert next month.
She got the way to groove me.
She got the way to move me, honey.
Bernadette: Maybe we can do it next week.
Should we just do couples?
Faster, faster, faster! Do you not know that word? It means more fast!
Hey, you’ll know when I’m yelling at you.
Come on, numb nuts, it’s the comic book store.
Because you’re in the right lane behind a bus and you won’t go around it? I’m sure she finds it charming.
I’m starting to think she dodged a bullet. The slowest bullet in the world.
Yeah, I know. Its, it’s probably because I grew up with five brothers and sisters so I had to fight for every… Oh, my God, you did not just slow down for a bird, you know they fly, right?
Go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go! How am I faster than you? I’m in heels and I stopped to take a phone call.
Hey, Romeo. Repair your relationship on your own time.
I knew it, we’re gonna lose.
Congratulations, you got it last.
Don’t sweat it, my dad’s a cop. He can fix things.
Who cares? Focus on the game.
No. Quitting would be the worst thing for your relationship.
Because it would make you seem like something she already thinks you are.
How do I put this? She’s been known to call you a name that usually applies to a lady part. Or a cat. Or a willow.
If you’re gonna cry about it there’s tissues in my purse. Unless you got some in yours. Big willow.
Can you reach the clue?
Hurry, Sheldon and Penny were right behind us in the bowling alley.
Great, climb back up. Come on.
Let’s go.
They’re here first. This is because you made me slow down for that blind guy.
No, she doesn’t. I just made that up.
Because you were about to quit like a big, Sheldon, cover your ears.
Wish I had a man like her on my team.
Maybe the spot’s the clue.
Stop her, Leonard, stop her.
Then where’s the coin?
You suck so hard.
Howard: Whoa, whoa, we’re not that sorry.
Hallelujah.
Why?
Oh, I loved those. I did them every year there.
Oh, that’s cute. Like it’s a real college.
And Princeton.
Yes, to be fair, do people who went to Princeton get a head start?
Wow, you’re really good at puzzles.
If it makes you feel any better, my mom’s just full of pound cake.
Have you ever played a game with Bernadette?
Have you ever gone into a steel cage with a wolverine?
It’s the comic book store. Let’s go.
Huh, I guess you’re right. Wonder why that is?
Yeah. You know, I bet you and I have more in common than we think.
I don’t know. Tell me some things you like.
Hey, how about some music?
Find something you like.
Yeah, I love Neil Diamond.
Riddle me this. Arrah, Arrah, and gather round, the work of this hero is legion-bound. He multiplies N by the number of He, and in this room the thing you’ll see.
Hey, you know what this could mean
That’s it.
On the boats and on the planes.
Never looking back again.
They’re coming to America, They’re coming to America.
Today!
Love on the rocks.
Just pour me a drink.
Let’s go.
Hey, she got the way to move me, Cherry,
Cherry, baby
Cherry
Penny: I love scavenger hunts. My friends and I had them all the time.
Oh, in ours we would just run around town looking for a store that would sell us beer.
Whoa, whoa, whoa. Why don’t you just admit you don’t want to be on a team with me.
Mm-hmm, yeah, you don’t think I’m smart enough. You think I’m gonna be a liability. Even though I totally just used the word liability correctly in a sentence. Yeah.
No, no. Let’s mix things up. I choose Sheldon, and we’re gonna kick your ass!
Thank you. Do you want to be on my team?
All right, hurry up and close the door so they can’t hear us. Would you stop pouting? So, you picked my name. Get over it.
No.
Well, there’s no right way, Sheldon. I already found a few pieces that fit.
Ooh, ooh, it’s the comic book store. All right, come on, that’s where we have to go.
But, it, it doesn’t matter. We know the answer, come on.
Okay, it’s not gonna say that.
It’s the comic book store, it’s the comic book store, it’s the comic book store.
Ugh, we’re the last ones here, hurry up.
People run in a marathon.
Riddle me this…
Hey, Princeton, look at that, Team Community College Night School is in the lead.
Aha. Okay, let’s see. To continue on your quest, leave no stone unturned. Ooh.
Oh. Okay. Sheldon, I, I’ve got to ask, how did you figure out that it was the geology lab?
Yes.
Wow. I can drink a beer underwater.
Shut up. I solved it.
Well, wait. Don’t you want to know how I figured it out?
Okay. Oh, it’s a bowling alley.
Let’s go.
Three bags, no one’s opened ’em. we’re the first ones here.
What? Why me?
Okay, the clue must be in the bag.
It’s just a bunch of pants.
You know, I’m surprised you want to copy my answers since I’m not even smart enough to be on your team.
What are you talking about?
Yeah, well, you should have quit ’cause I’m still gonna beat your ass.
Oh.
But wait. So does this one.
Sheldon’s spot. The coin is in your spot.
Well, where the hell’s the coin?
I don’t get it.
That is the stupidest thing I’ve ever heard.
Run.
Run to India.
Both: Sweet Caroline, bum-ba-da, good times never seemed so good, so good, so good, so good. I’ve been inclined…
Stuart: Oh, my pleasure. Always happy to help out with fun things that I wasn’t invited to be a part of.
Yeah. So when you guys plan fun activities, does my name even come up, or…?
So no one’s gonna buy anything.
Together: She got the way to groove me. She got the way to move me.
She got the way to groove me, yeah!
